Summary: Biochemical reaction from 2,6-xylidine to 4-hydroxyxylidine. This interaction is catalyzed by CYP2E1.
Biochemical reaction from monoethylglycinexylidide to glycinexylidide.
Biochemical reaction from lidocaine to 2,6-xylidine. This interaction is catalyzed by CES1.
Biochemical reaction from lidocaine to 3-hydroxylidocaine. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP1A2 or CYP3A4.
Biochemical reaction from 2,6-xylidine to 2,6-dimethylphenylhydroxylamine. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP2B6, CYP2A6, CYP1A2 or CYP2D6.
Biochemical reaction from lidocaine to monoethylglycinexylidide. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP1A2 or CYP3A4.
